BREACH CRITICAL Version 2.0 (Corrected)

Somatoform Contamination: The Covert Diagnosis

How a Psychiatric Label Was Applied Without Assessment, Knowledge, or Basis

Date: 2026-01-18
Status: CURRENT
Source: FOUNDATIONAL_ESSAY_SOMATOFORM_CONTAMINATION_CORRECTED_2026-01-18.docx

Executive Summary

Documents how Dr Bulale Ali applied Somatoform Pain Disorder (F45.4) during a telephone consultation about opioid medication switching on 5 January 2023 - after MRI had confirmed T5-T8 vertebral fractures. The patient was never informed. The diagnosis was later removed by Dr Gorrie in July 2025 with the note 'there were clear causes for his pain.'

Key Arguments

1

Psychiatric diagnosis applied without psychiatric assessment

2

Applied after objective pathology (vertebral fractures) confirmed on imaging

3

Patient never informed of diagnosis

4

Wrong ICD-10 code used (E278 instead of F45.4) suggesting unfamiliarity

5

Independently removed by subsequent GP as self-evidently inappropriate

6

Pain Clinic explicitly refuted somatoform characterisation

Supporting Evidence

F040 BREACH

Somatoform Diagnosis Applied Without Assessment

Dr Bulale Ali applied Somatoform Pain Disorder during a telephone consultation about switching opioid medication - NOT a psychiatric assessment. Patient was never informed. Applied AFTER MRI had proven T5-T8 fractures. Wrong ICD-10 code used (E278 instead of F45.4).
F030 VINDICATION

Dr Gorrie Removes Somatoform Diagnosis

Dr Alexander Gorrie marked the Somatoform Pain Disorder diagnosis as INACTIVE on 22 July 2025, noting 'there were clear causes for his pain.' Highly unusual to remove without formal psychiatric reassessment - error was self-evident.
F031 VINDICATION

Pain Clinic Refutes Somatoform

Pain Clinic explicitly disagreed with somatoform characterisation. GP record states: 'GP prev told somatic, pain clinic at C&W; felt not somatic.'
F038 VINDICATION

Psychiatric Assessment Clearance

Psychiatric assessment by Dr Gupta found NO: PTSD, depression, psychosis, personality disorder, OR somatisation disorder. Presentation consistent with inadequately treated physical illness.
F127 VINDICATION

Karunaratne Letter 2 Days Pre-Somatoform Documents Physical Symptoms

Two days before Somatoform applied (05/01/2023), Dr Karunaratne documented: 'Pain remains a major concern,' patient 'needs to prop himself against a wall' to sleep, MRI spine completed, skull surgery scheduled. No psychiatric concerns raised.
F323 FND/SOMATOFORM

Not Reviewed by FND Team as of Aug 2022 (TEMPORAL)

Dr Simeoni documented: 'Has never been reviewed by the FND team at St George's.' AS OF AUGUST 2022, patient had not been formally assessed by FND team despite FND appearing in records.
